Question: This patient had a generalized  acute viral disease caused by the mumps virus. What happened as a result?
Choices: (A) The patient was diagnosed with the ischemia. (B) He was assigned to the ward of mumps.

Mumps is a viral infection that primarily affects the salivary glands, causing swelling and pain. However, in rare cases, mumps can lead to complications such as inflammation of the brain (encephalitis), inflammation of the testicles (orchitis), and inflammation of the ovaries (oophoritis). One of the less common complications of mumps is ischemia, which occurs when there is a lack of blood flow to a particular part of the body. Ischemia can lead to tissue damage and even organ failure if left untreated. Therefore, it is more plausible that the patient was diagnosed with ischemia as a result of the mumps infection.
